alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 8:23PM CST until February 26 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Reagan County in western Texas... Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... Dawson County in western Texas... * Until 1000 PM CST. * At 822 PM CST, blowing dust remains lofted across portions of the northern and eastern Permian Basin. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 152 and 228. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Snyder, Lamesa, Colorado City, Big Lake, Ackerly, Gail, Garden City, Stanton, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Luther, Fluvanna and J B Thomas Reservoir. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Dawson; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry
